2. Plan ahead: Create a schedule and plan your day in advance. Allocate time slots for each task and stick to them.

3. Break down large tasks: Divide large tasks into smaller, manageable steps. This will help you to avoid feeling overwhelmed.

4. Eliminate distractions: Identify what distracts you the most and eliminate them. This could be turning off your phone or finding a quiet place to work.

5. Use a timer: Use a timer to help you stay on task and avoid procrastination. Set a timer for a specific amount of time and work until the timer goes off.

6. Prioritize: Prioritize your tasks based on importance and urgency. This will help you to stay on track and avoid wasting time on less important tasks.

7. Take breaks: Take regular breaks to recharge and avoid burnout. Use this time to relax or engage in a different activity.

8. Evaluate your progress: Regularly evaluate your progress and adjust your schedule as needed. This will help you to stay focused and achieve your goals.

9. Learn to say no:  Don't be afraid to say no to requests that don't align with your priorities. This will help you to focus on what matters most.
